DOC.brief_summary: Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome ( OHSS ) major complication ovarian stimulation IVF hCG use trigger final oocyte maturation . The investigator propose use GnRH agonist trigger eliminate OHSS , even high-risk patient .
DOC.brief_title: Can GnRH Agonist Trigger Prevent Ovarian Hyperstimulation Syndrome ?
DOC.detailed_description: Administration hCG ( 10.000 5.000 IU ) essential IVF protocol trigger final oocyte maturation ovarian stimulation . In high responder patient potential risk develop OHSS , hCG usually withhold treatment cycle cancel without obtain ( cryopreserved ) embryo replacement . An alternative approach trigger final oocyte maturation administer GnRH agonist instead hCG . This method possible follow long GnRH agonist protocol cause down-regulation GnRH receptor . However , follow GnRH antagonist treatment GnRH receptor remain receptive competitive binding GnRH agonist . It well-described earlier IVF trial bolus GnRH agonist displace GnRH antagonist GnRH receptor pituitary induce endogenous LH ( FSH ) surge result maturation oocyte good quality embryo . In addition , risk moderate-to-severe ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome ( OHSS ) become minimal due rapid demise corpus lutea . Following luteolysis , fresh embryo transfer would require alternative luteal phase support secure good clinical outcome . Alternatively , good quality embryo obtain GnRH agonist trigger cryopreserved replace follow frozen-thawn embryo transfer ( FTET ) cycle . Thus , also eliminate late onset OHSS due pregnancy .
